intro: Arnebia cornuta, commonly known as the horned arnebia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its striking, pink to red, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are upright and branching. Arnebia cornuta is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
